meanings.definition: The side wings of a stage.
meanings.sent1: The actors waited nervously in the coulises before going on stage.
meanings.sent2: The stagehands moved the props behind the coulises during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sneaked into the coulises and disrupted the play.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts lingered in the coulises of her mind, hidden from the audience.
meanings.sent5: The coulises whispered secrets to the actors, guiding their movements on stage.

meanings.definition: A narrow strip of land between two fields.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted crops on the coulises separating his wheat and corn fields.
meanings.sent2: Children played tag in the coulises between the meadows, enjoying the open space.
meanings.sent3: The coulises were the perfect spot for a picnic, with a view of both fields.
meanings.sent4: The coulises shimmered under the sun, dividing the golden wheat from the green corn.
meanings.sent5: Birds chirped happily in the coulises, hopping from one field to the other.
